body: if someone wants to take a look at this, please feel free to do so :)
@caarlos0, I will do. if its okay?

Hi @rnikoopour,

i try to recreate your scenario, but i can't recreate it to see the same as you:

What did i do:

1. Create an AWS S3 (Question 1: Are you using aws s3 or an s3 compatible storage?)
1. Postivie Test with full access (r+w)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325136/141836286-b5694fb5-1336-4933-8700-7e797d8634c4.png)
1. Remove Write Access
``` 
тип release failed after 12.53s error=blobs: failed to publish artifacts: failed to write to bucket: blob (key "minectl/v0.12.0/minectl_0.12.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz") (code=Unknown): AccessDenied: Access Denied
```

Do you have some more input about your settings?

> Question 1: Are you using aws s3 or an s3 compatible storage?

I was using AWS S3.

> Do you have some more input about your settings?

What more information do you need regarding the settings?    

Off the top of my head I don't really have more information.  I never removed write access for the credentials that were being used.  I may have had expired AWS credentials in my `~/.aws/credentials` but I didn't have a profile set when I tried to upload and it failed silently. 

My colleague was able to reproduce the error on his machine.  During one of our last releases it silently failed.  He was in the same situation with expired credentials in `~/.aws/credentials` with no profile set.

> Remove Write Access

How did you remove the write access?  In my scenario I never removed any explicit permissions.  I just didn't have a valid AWS Profile set and the creds stored in `~/.aws/credentials` were expired.

hi @rnikoopour,

that will be helpful. Currently i test with setting the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY and AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID but try to rebuild your scenario!

Thanks
I'm seeing the same issue. My output looks slightly different, but same overall problem - no errors are reported.
@dirien thanks for digging into this and trying to repro.  The photo from @dorner is the same output I had.

@dorner and @rnikoopour are you using some kind of oidc/SSO to provide the credentials? Maybe AWS SSO?

@dorner: can you explain your setup? are you using the aws cli for auth? That would help me much to reconstruct the issue to find a solution.
